intro: Cuphea tetrapetala var. cosangae, commonly known as the purple flame cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, tubular, violet-pink bracts that surround small, yellow flowers. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that are typical of the Lythraceae family. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
